attributes.action: Stop the introduction of GP referral management centres
attributes.additional_details:
Research by the British Medical Journal 

Summary of data from the BMJ http://www.bmj.com/company/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/CCG-ref-schemes.pdf

Referral management schemes: good for whom?
doi: https://doi.org/10.1136/bmj.i6856 (Published 04 January 2017) 

Private firms run a third of CCGs’ schemes to screen GP referrals
doi: https://doi.org/10.1136/bmj.i6855 (Published 04 January 2017)
attributes.background: GP referrals to specialist must now be approved and vetted by referral management centres. However, the British Medical Journal (BMJ) reported that there is no evidence the centres are reducing costs and improving quality of referrals. Thus, the centres serve to reduce access to medical treatment.

rejection.details:
The decision to use referral management centres appears to be one for local Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs), not the UK Government or Parliament. 

You may wish to contact your local CCG directly. You can find out who your local CCG is and how to contact them here: https://www.nhs.uk/Service-Search/Clinical-Commissioning-Group/LocationSearch/1
